text: Graffiti is the third studio album by American recording artist Chris Brown. It was released on December 7, 2009 by CBE and Jive Records. It is his first album after being arrested for beating up his ex-girlfriend Barbadian R&B; singer Rihanna earlier in 2009. ==Track listing== * (co.) signifies a co- producer. ==Charts== ===Weekly charts=== Chart (2009) Peak position Australian Albums Chartaustralian-charts.com – Chris Brown – Graffiti 40 French Albums Chart 134 German Albums Chart 83 Irish Albums Chart 47 New Zealand Albums Chartcharts.org.nz – Chris Brown – Graffiti 40 UK Albums Chart 55 UK R&B; Chart 11 US Billboard 200 7 US Top R&B;/Hip-Hop Albums 1 ===Year- end charts=== Chart (2010) Position US Billboard 200 113 ==Release history== Country Date Germany December 7, 2009 United Kingdom December 7, 2009 United States December 8, 2009 ==References== Category:2009 albums Category:Dance albums Category:Hip hop albums Category:R&B; albums
title: Graffiti (album)
